description: Databricks is a data and AI platform that unifies data engineering, analytics, and machine learning on a lakehouse architecture.
company_overview: Databricks has hired Mike Daniels as Vice President and General Manager of Public Sector to lead its growing public sector practice.
news: Tredence is honored to announce its recognition as the 2025 Databricks Growth Partner of the Year for the Americas. Recognized for bridging the 'Last Mile' in AI and accelerating RoI realization and growth for enterprises in the Americas through industry-specific Data and AI solutions. The award highlights Tredence's impactful achievements and forward-thinking innovation in driving scalable AI transformation. Tredence and Databricks' collaboration has resulted in measurable impact for joint customers across retail, CPG, healthcare, TMT, Travel & Hospitality and industrial sectors. Backed by elite partner status, Tredence's investment in a robustDatabricks Business Unit, coupled with a growing pool of 600+ Databrick-certified practitioners, reinforces its commitment to delivering repeatable, scalable, and outcome-focused transformations. "AI's true test is in the last mile—where strategy becomes progress. That's where Tredence delivers," said Rakesh Sancheti, Chief Growth Officer at TredENCE. "Winning the Growth Partner of the Year award for the Americas reaffirms our belief that sustained enterprise modernization begins when AI moves from experimentation to execution," said Shashank Dubey. The Tredence's partnership with Databricks continues to shape enterprise innovation across the Americas. The joint efforts are unlocking real-world value for enterprises across industries. "We are proud to recognize TredENCE as our Growth Partner of the Year for the Americas," said Jason McIntyre, VP, Partner Development at Databrick. Enabled a major healthcare provider to achieve 35% faster data processing through a strategic cloud migration. Deployed Smart Manufacturing Command Center to cut maintenance costs by 19%, boost throughput by 12%, and speed up root cause analysis by 40%. Adds to this honor, Tredence was also awarded the Databricks Retail & CPG Partner of the Year for the fourth consecutive time.  Lovelytics wins two prestigious awards at the 2025 Databricks Data + AI Summit. The company has 3,500+ employees across San Francisco Bay Area, Chicago, London, Toronto, and Bengaluru. Lovelytics stood out for its deep technical expertise, customer-first approach, and strategic partnerships. Lovelytics Sweeps Multiple Honors at Databricks Partner Awards: Enterprise & Emerging Business Unit and Media & Entertainment.Across the Americas, Lovelytics has enabled enterprises and emerging businesses to unlock growth through AI and modern data platforms. Highlights of delivered business value include: Hyper-personalized customer experiences and real-time inventory optimization for retail brands. Lovelytics earned the Databricks Communications, Media & Entertainment, and Gaming Partner of the Year Award. It implemented real-time content personalization and a scalable, cloud-native architecture. The engagement resulted in a 30% reduction in operational costs and a 50% increase in platform adoption. Lovelytics has led the way in delivering impactful solutions across industries at enterprise scale. The awards follow Lovelytics' merger with Nousot and acquisition of LATAM consultancy Datalytics. Backed by Databricks Ventures and Interlock Equity, the firm operates across North America, LATAM, and Europe. The Lovelytics website is available in English and Spanish. For more information, visit www.lovelytics.com. For confidential support call the Samaritans on 08457 909090 or visit a local Samaritans branch, see www.samaritans.org. In the U.S. call the National Suicide Prevention Line on 1-800-273-8255.

Andy Konwinski.wikipedia_summary:
Perplexity AI, or simply Perplexity, is an American web search engine that uses a large language model to process queries and synthesize responses based on web search results. With a conversational approach, Perplexity allows users to ask follow-up questions and receive answers with citations to its sources from the internet.

Ion Stoica.wikipedia_summary: Ion Stoica (born 1964 or 1965) is a Romanian–American computer scientist specializing in distributed systems, cloud computing and computer networking. He is a professor of computer science at the University of California, Berkeley and co-director of AMPLab. He co-founded Conviva and Databricks with other original developers of Apache Spark and Anyscale with other original developers of Ray.

Matei Zaharia.wikipedia_summary:
Matei Zaharia (born 1984 or 1985) is a Romanian-Canadian computer scientist, educator and the creator of Apache Spark.
As of 2024, Forbes ranked him and Ion Stoica as the 3rd-richest Romanians with a net worth of $2.7 billion.


== Biography ==
Zaharia graduated from secondary school at Jarvis Collegiate Institute before moving to become an undergraduate at the University of Waterloo.

Patrick Wendell.wikipedia_summary: Databricks, Inc. is a global data, analytics, and artificial intelligence (AI) company, founded in 2013 by the original creators of Apache Spark. The company provides a cloud-based platform to help enterprises build, scale, and govern data and AI, including generative AI and other machine learning models.

Reynold Xin.wikipedia_summary: Reynold Xin is a computer scientist and engineer specializing in big data, distributed systems, and cloud computing. He is a co-founder and Chief Architect of Databricks. He is best known for his work on Apache Spark, a leading open-source Big Data project.
